DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Actual Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of applying, dispensing or otherwise giving medications or other substances to experimental units. EXAMPLE(S): An experimental unit who receives methotrexate as part of chemotherapy, radiation therapy. For a SubstanceAdministration, targetAnatomicSiteCode = "coronary artery", approachAnatomicSiteCode = "groin", routeOfAdministrationCode = "intra-arterial". The date and time span when this activity began and ended. EXAMPLE(S): The date and time when a sample is taken from the subject. A dose of chemotherapy is given on June 12th starting at 9am and finishing at 12pm.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Actual Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Existing in fact; real.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Existing in fact; real.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
